question: What type of mutation is causing the industrial melanism phenotype in peppered moths?
ideal_answer: The mutation event giving rise to industrial melanism in Britain was the insertion of a large, tandemly repeated, transposable element into the first intron of the gene cortex.

snippets.text: The industrial melanism mutation in British peppered moths is a transposable element.
Here we show that the mutation event giving rise to industrial melanism in Britain was the insertion of a large, tandemly repeated, transposable element into the first intron of the gene cortex.
